name: Intesa Sanpaolo
membership:
- European Parliamentary Financial Services Forum
- Associazione per la promozione e ricerca in Europa
goal:
Intesa Sanpaolo is among the top banking groups in the euro zone, with a market capitalisation of 36.3 billion euro as at 31 January 2017.
Intesa Sanpaolo is the leader in Italy in all business areas (retail, corporate, and wealth management). The Group offers its services to 11.1 million customers through a network of over 4,000 branches well distributed throughout the country with market shares no lower than 12% in most Italian regions.
Intesa Sanpaolo has a selected presence in Central Eastern Europe and Middle Eastern and North African areas with approximately 1,200 branches and 7.9 million customers belonging to the Group's subsidiaries operating in commercial banking in 12 countries.
Moreover, an international network of specialists in support of corporate customers spreads across 29 countries, in particular in the Middle East and North Africa and in those areas where Italian companies are most active, such as the United States, Brazil, Russia, India and China.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, External Relations, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
EU Growth policies (e.g. European Fund for Strategic Investments - Innovative financial products - Digital Single Market)
Financial Services regulation (e.g. capital markets union - banking union - bank capital requirements - trading and post trading regulatory framework - tax issues - payment systems)
